question: Private plans outside Pennie Open Enrollment
text:
Private plans outside Pennie Open Enrollment
          
        
In some limited cases, insurance companies sell private health plans outside of 
Open Enrollment
 that count as 
qualifying health coverage
.
Please take note of the following with regard to these plans:


Pennie does not list or offer these plans. The only way you can enroll in a health plan through Pennie outside of Open Enrollment is if you qualify for a 
Special Enrollment Period
.


You can find these plans through some insurance companies, agents, brokers, and online health insurance sellers. 
If you buy a plan outside of Pennie at any time, you are not eligible for premium tax credits or other financial assistance based on your income.


Insurance companies can tell you if a particular plan counts as minimum essential coverage. Each plan's Summary of Benefits and Coverage also includes this information.
